moves.1. e4: 1.e4. I alternate this and 1.d4. I don't have a preference.
moves.2... Nf6: the main line here is 2...d5 where white has the option of either 3.Nc3,3.Nd2,3.e5,or 3.exd5
moves.3. Nc3: defending the pawn and developing the piece
moves.3... Na6: ?! an odd move. "Knights on the rim are dim"
moves.4. Nf3 h6: again,another odd move. Black prevents Bg5 but I was not planning to develop my bishop there.
moves.5. Bxa6: I take the Bad Knight which,in retrospect is a bad move.
moves.5... bxa6: however the double isolated a-pawns will be a permanent weakness for me to targer
moves.6. O-O: I was really feeling good about my position
moves.6... Bb7: fianchettoing the Bishop and attacking the pawn
moves.7... Bxe4: This was the turning point for my attitude of the game. I was not going to lay down and die. I was going to win the game at all cost. Whatever it takes. For my friend.
moves.8. Nd2: not recapturing the piece. I'm going to need them
moves.8... Bb7 9. Re1: White is better developed at this point and I was looking for an attack.
moves.10. Bxd6: I take it,I want to double the pawns up. I at least want to win this pawn back.
moves.11... Qc7: I was hoping he would be generous,but nay he wants to be stubborn!
moves.12. Qe2: bringing the queen into the fray and defending the knight
moves.12... h5: perhaps to lauch an attack on the kingside?
moves.13. Rad1: I am centralizing all of my pieces because I want to open the center,thus opening lines to the king!
moves.13... Qc6 14. f3 d5: a minor mistake IMO. The Knight will play an important role on e5
moves.15... Qc7 16. f4: I want to play 17.f5. I do not have to worry about the a8-h1 diagonal being open now
moves.16... Ne4 17. Nxe4 dxe4 18. Qc4: ! A psychologically good move! "When you are ahead in material trade pieces" So can you imagine his joy when I offered a trade of Queens?
moves.18... Qxc4: ?! Whoops! This gives me the pawn back!
moves.19... O-O 20. Nd6: Doesn't matter I play it anyway!
moves.20... Bd5 21. c4: An in between move that is not really necessary but gains time
moves.21... Bc6 22. Nxe4 Bxe4 23. Rxe4: Yes! I got the pawn back! White has the better position again
moves.25... Rab8 26. b3: I don't want to trade pawns,which brings it closer to a draw. I want a win!
moves.26... Rfd8 27. Re7 g6: 27...Ra8 defends the pawn but after 28.Rc7 followed by 29.Rc6,a pawn will fall
moves.28. Rxa7 Rb6 29. Ra5: White now wins the other weak pawn that he created on the 5th move!
moves.29... Re8 30. Kf2: no need to hurry. This gets the King involved and covers the 2nd rank
moves.30... Re4 31. g3: now that everything is defended. I will win the pawn
moves.31... h4 32. Ra7xa6 Rxa6 33. Rxa6 hxg3+: This is a winning Rook endgame. White just needs to convert
moves.36... Rc1 37. a5: White can win the pawn immediately but just keeps pushing the pawn.
moves.37... Rc3+ 38. Kf2 Rxb3 39. Rxd6: now White choses to get the pawn back
moves.39... Kf8 40. Rb6: offering a trade of rooks that would be very favorable to White
moves.40... Rc3 41. a6: I don't care about the pawn
moves.43... Ra3 44. Rxf7 Kc6 45. Rf6+: lets just win the other pawn
moves.47... Rc3 48. f6 Rxc4: Black wins a pawn,but is already lost
moves.49. f7 Rc8 50. Rg8: the rest is without commentary. I just convert it
moves.50... Rxg8 51. fxg8=Q Kb6 52. Qd5 Kc7 53: An emotional victory for me. Thanks in advance for any comments
